settings.blog-title: 6 ONLINE YOGA CLASSES FOR YOUR AT HOME PRACTICE

settings.text: Yoga has become incredibly popular in recent years. But, creating a thriving yoga practice doesn’t have to mean making time for regular studio visits. At-home yoga is the perfect way to focus your practice on specific areas or poses, and it fits into your routine better, especially if you have school runs, commutes and work to contend with. To help you cultivate a practice that fits around your life, here are six of the best online yoga platforms to get you started.

settings.grid-content:
1. Yoga with Adriene

Cost: Free
Find What Feels Good subscription: $9.99 USD per month

The original online yoga sensation, Yoga With Adriene is an entire YouTube channel with classes ranging from six minutes to full-hour practices. Started by Adriene Mishler - who leads all classes mostly from her home with her trusty pooch, Benji, by her side - has videos to suit all levels. Whether you’re looking to improve your flexibility, relieve lower-back pain, or want to commit to 30 days of uninterrupted practice, YWA will have it.

2. Glo

Cost: $18 USD per month

Glo has it all. For busy parents looking to squeeze in a morning energy boost before the school run, to the exhausted commuter who needs a yoga nidra practice for a full night’s sleep. There’s something for everyone; you could brush up on the basics or break a sweat with an advanced vinyasa flow - perfect for those who know their Bakasana from their Baddha Konasana. With some of the world’s leading teachers, Glo helps you create an online yoga practice that is unique to your needs and schedule.

3. FLYLDN

Cost: £9.99 per month

FLYLDN gained recognition in the capital thanks to their immersive screens and their impressive teachers. Classes range from Base Flow and Chill - for beginners and those who prefer a slower practice - to Flowlife and Deep House Stretch - if you’re in need of something more powerful to help build up a sweat. FLYLDN allows you to cultivate your own practice thanks to their on-demand and extensive workout library, as well as daily live classes.

settings.text:
4. HelloYoga

Cost: Free for a seven-day trial. After that, classes are available in packs - 2 for £39, 4 for £49 or 6 for £89

For those who prefer the personalised experience that an in-person yoga teacher can offer, HelloYoga is one of the best yoga apps available. It provides the completely unique experience of one-to-one classes from tutors across the world - it’s the closest you’ll ever get to the real thing.

5. 1Rebel (RebelTV)

Cost: Free for a five day trial. Then £15.99 a month. £25.99 three-month saver plan available.

1Rebel gyms made a name for themselves through their cult spin classes, but the gym has now launched its very own at-home workout service - Rebel TV - which just so happens to include online yoga classes. For some deep stretching and strength building - especially if you already follow a gym routine - these yoga classes will complement your existing workouts.

6. Do Yoga With Me

Cost: Free

Do Yoga With Me is an expansive website that offers a range of videos from full-hour long classes to meditation practices and breathing exercises. It survives on donations, but generously provides a variety of instructors and different yoga styles, from Vinyasa and Ashtanga, to Hatha and Yin, as well as prenatal classes. If you consider yourself an intermediate yogi, broaden your horizons through breathing techniques and meditations.
